alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Mercer (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 11:12PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hunterdon, Mercer and southeastern Bucks Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1112 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Washington Crossing, or 8 miles northwest of Trenton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Trenton, Ewing, Princeton, Pennington, Yardley, Newtown, Hopewell, Langhorne, Washington Crossing, Langhorn, Lawrenceville, Woodside, Richboro, Plainsboro Center, Mercerville-Hamilton Square, Langhorne Manor, Princeton Junction, Woodbourne, Village Shires and Newtown Grant. This includes Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 65 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
